isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - SUPPLEMENTAL DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES

svcproc.title: Oil Consumption

step1.para: Inspect for external oil leaks and correct
Check for air cleaner restriction, air induction system leaks, excessive crankcase pressure, and faulty air compressor

note.para: Change the air filter element and inspect the turbocharger for damage if lube oil is drawn into the engine.

svcproc.para: If the above conditions are not the cause of oil consumption, continue analysis.

item.para: Change the oil (use the recommended API Specification and viscosity for current ambient temperature values).
Determine initial oil consumption rate and trend at: 1000 miles/50 hours and 5000 miles/250 hours.
Record the amount of make up oil added during the test period.

svcproc.para: Excessive oil consumption can be caused by:

item.para: Abnormally heavy loads pulled by the vehicle (above the specified GVW).
Incorrect operation (i.e. allowing the engine to lug in the incorrect gear range) resulting in oil consumption.
Faulty air compressor (if compressor piston rings are worn, oil can be forced into the air system).
Worn engine valve guides or valve stem seals (clean and inspect).
Worn rings or bores from normal wear or dirt passing through the air filter element (perform crankcase pressure test).
Defective injector O-ring allowing oil to mix with fuel. See ICP leakage test in Section 2, Hard Start / No Start Diagnostics.
